post.author: BNA!
post.body:
It's worth noting Apple carries Rage (HD) on the App store.

http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/rage-hd/id400707675?mt=8

Here's my quick first impression on the iPad:

Surprisingly good graphics
Arcade Railshooter (only mildly annoying)
3 Weapons (Pistol, Machinegun, Shotgun)
3 Levels 8 to 10 minutes each
Cheap
Controls work better than expected
No online stats
Fast action with not much time to look around
Very fluent on the iPad

Downside: you can't lower the console and type "editor"

It's a nice, small and early glimpse into Rage. Given the pricepoint it's a nobrainer (actually it's the first game I paid for in the App store).

post.author: parsonsbear
post.body:
DL'd it, but my iPhone is too old to play it. I guess the early pre-3G models only run up to iOS 3.1.3, and 3.2 is required.

Saaaad. But i did crack it open- the trailer/intro looks damn awesome.

Sally's crazy hat is back! (this is, btw, the highest res image available of her, the QCon 2007 video was never released at high quality.
http://mixomracing.com/sally.jpg

Looks like Sally and Dinny aren't the only female wastelanders either, JK Stiles has some rollerderby looking companions as well:
http://mixomracing.com/rollerderbyStiles.jpg

As an aside, it looks very similar to Doom Resurrection in terms of engine- it's still internally referred to as the Cobalt engine, uses compiled LUA for scripting/ui bindings. There's a bunch of PVR's for items/monsters/ui, but the maps and miniMegaTextures are all memory mapped binaries.
